Haha, David did get it right RJ, I just didn't send this one in.  He  says,=
 
Radio twice!!!  So, cool, I didn't think he was right, but i guess,  he w=
as 
after all. sf
 
 
In a message dated 7/14/2010 5:31:02 P.M. Eastern Day=
light Time,  
rasterer@... writes:

 
 
 


Snowfire, I do have more =
than one monitor.   Some are in my closet (so not 
in this room, and not ne=
ar me).  And  the others in this room are laptops.  
None of the laptops ha=
d  anything on them.  And the monitors in the closet 
just have other  equi=
pment on them.

But now that I've sent out a picture of the  monitor, next =
time everyone 
knows what it looks like, so maybe that will  help.  Or, I'm=
 open to 
suggestions for other locations for the  object in question too. =
 This was just close 
to me (I would see it  every day), and was also the m=
onitor I use for this  
newsgroup.


--- On Wed, 7/14/10, SnowfireL@...=
, 7/14/10, <SnowfireL@...> wrote:


From:  SnowfireL@...<SnowfireL=
@...>
Subject: Re:  [EVP-ITC] Experiment 20100710 - RESULTS!
To:  EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroupsTo: 
Date: Wednesday, July 14, 2010, 2:00  PM


 
Well, RJ do=
n't know why they couldn't get it, maybe that thing doesn't look 
like a mo=
nitor to them,  looks more like a box, do you have more then one 
monitor i=
n your  house?  If David got it wrong, it was my fault for not  
understand=
ing Him.  sf
 
 
In a message dated 7/14/2010 2:20:10 P.M. Eastern Daylight=
 Time,  
rasterer@yahoo. com writes:

 

Thanks again for everyone who part=
icipated! I admire your  courage and 
motivation to try different methods, =
see what works, and  try to improve 
everyone's understanding of EVP-ITC.

=
If you  recall, on 7/10/2010 I placed an object on top of my computer  
mon=
itor, right in front of me, and left it there until today,  7/14/2010, noon=
 
Denver time. The experiment was for participants to  determine what it wa=
s. 
Vague or partial answers wouldn't be counted  (for example, just colors=
, 
shapes, sizes, what it's made of, etc):  we're looking for what it is. 
=
Participants could use their ghost  boxes, EVP recorders, or I suppose any =
other 
means they  chose.

In order to keep me honest, I took a picture of =
the  object at the start of 
the experiment and loaded it to the Files  sec=
tion (RJ folder) of this 
group. If you can follow the link, it is  here:

=
_http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/  EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ.20100710. 
1.z=
ip_ (http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ.20100710.1.zip)=
 

The idea was that  you could download the file at the beginning of the 
=
test, and 'keep  it safe' on your computer. Then at the end of the test, I =
would 
 release the password so you could reveal the contents of the file. =
 That 
way, you were in control of the original image during the  entire te=
st, not 
me. 

The password for that file is:  123BlastOff
Instructions, if=
 you need them, are also in that RJ  folder.

And if you did not care to do=
wnload the zip file  before the test, I will 
post the final image there to=
o.

So to  the results:

Number of participants: 5
Total tries:  8
Ambiguou=
s answers: 0
Correct answers: 0

Object: A  radio
Uzipped picture:
_http://=
tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/  EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ.20100710. 
1.JPG_ (htt=
p://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ.20100710.1.JPG) 

So wh=
at do the  results mean? All that we can really agree on from this 
experim=
ent  is that no participant, with whatever theories or methods or  
technol=
ogy they used, was able to correctly determine the object. We  can't say 
t=
hose theories or methods or technologies never work. Just  as we can't say =

they do. Just that, for whatever reason, they did  not work this time. 
Re=
aders can take the results, use them to  improve or change their methods, o=
r 
keep doing what they're  doing.

If anyone has any observations, comment=
s, or ideas for  improvement, let me 
know. I hope to get a new experiment =
up and  running soon. Since there 
wasn't much participation Mon-Wed, I thi=
nk  the next experiment will be arranged 
to mostly span the  weekends.

Ag=
ain, thanks to everyone who participated in this  first experiment.







=





--part1_7471c.5aec401d.396f87a0_alt_boundary
